title: News. Views. Hughes. - October 23, 2019 (17:00 ET)
text:
Huawei to license 5G tech to US companies

Huawei is exploring the possibility of selling its 5G technology in the form of patents, licenses, and codes to US companies. Meanwhile the Chinese telecommunications giant has pledged to become more "open and transparent." RT America's Sara Montes de Oca reports for News.Views.Hughes.

Trump takes credit for Syria ceasefire success

President Trump lifted US sanctions on Turkey when the latter announced that its ceasefire with Kurdish fighters in Syria will be permanent. Scottie Nell Hughes has the details. Then, former naval intelligence officer, John Jordan shares his insights. He argues that critics of President Trump’s Middle East strategy are members of Washington’s “national security blob” and reacting out of embarrassment.

House Republicans steal impeachment spotlight

Congressional Republicans theatrically barged into a closed-door deposition of Deputy Assistant Defense Sec. Laura Cooper before the House Intelligence Committee on Wednesday, demanding to hear her testimony, a part of the impeachment inquiry into President Trump. Civil Rights attorney Robert Patillo and Republican strategist John Thomas join News.Views.Hughes to discuss. They also discuss the limits of what’s acceptable in foreign policy.
description:
Huawei to license 5G tech to US companies 
Huawei is exploring the possibility of selling its 5G technology in the form of patents, licenses, and codes to US companies
